intro: Aeschynomene americana var. flabellata, commonly known as the sickleleaf aeschynomene, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its leaves are trifoliate, with the terminal leaflet being elongated and sickle-shaped, giving it its common name. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop due to its hardy nature and nutritional value.
